Package net.sf.openrds

Interface Summary
IMainNode Interface for the Main Node implementation.
A main node is responsible for distributing requisitions, controlling process nodes and load-balancing.
All requisitions to be processed must be passed to the main node, and never directly to a process node.
When the main node receives a new requisition, it will determine the best available node to process it and send the requistion for that node, to process it.
INode This RMI interface represents a generic node.
INodeEventListener Interface for listening to node events.
IProcessNode Represents a node with the ability of processing a requisition on it's own process.
ISystemProperties Holds constants that indentify system properties read by OpenRDS.
 

Class Summary
DivisibleRequisition Represents a requisition that can be splitted into many sub-requisitions.
IndivisibleRequisition Represents a requisition to be processed on a single node.
Node This class holds common properties and methods of a node.
NodeEventAdaptor Empty implementation of INodeEventListener, to avoid having to declare every listener's method.
NodeFactory This class can be used to help starting a main node and/or a process node, setting up a distributed system.
ProcessNode Represents a node with the ability of processing a requisition on it's own process.
RegistryHandler This class is responsible for the RMI Registry control.
Requisition Represents a requisition that can be serialized thru the network to be processed at any remote machine.
SubRequisition Represents a sub-requisition to be processed.
 

Exception Summary
NodeAlreadyExistsException This exception is thrown when trying to initialize a node that is already registered on the system.
NoNodesAvailableException This exception is thrown when no nodes were found for a determined action.
ProcessingException This exception is thrown by a requisition beeing processed
RegistryNotActiveException Exception thrown when trying to access the registry handler before initializing it.
